message_1: How many ways are there to choose 3 people from a group of 8 to form a committee?
message_2:
To choose 3 people from a group of 8, we can use the combination formula, which is:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of people (8 in this case) and k is the number of people we want to choose (3 in this case). The exclamation mark denotes the factorial of a number.

So, the number of ways to choose 3 people from a group of 8 is:

C(8, 3) = 8! / (3!(8-3)!)
= 8! / (3!5!)
= (8 × 7 × 6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((3 × 2 × 1)(5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1))
= (8 × 7 × 6) / (3 × 2 × 1)
= 336 / 6
= 56

There are 56 ways to choose 3 people from a group of 8 to form a committee.
